page.title: 14HOUSING DEVELOPMENT
page.content: 4 conservation sub-areas, 3 of which fall into the grid.These areas are set aside as being of special architectural interest and national importance. Within the first area some of the buildings have an unusual design, characteristic of the 1930's. This estate was never completed as a result of the advent of World War Two and therefore is of special interest.This area also contains a 'modern' group of housing by a well known 30's architect.This area marks the border between Frinton and Walton. The area inside 'the gates' (Frinton itself was not developed until 1886) contains 2 hotels, neo-Tudor housing and crescents of a typical Edwardian style which benefit from attractive sea-views.
